intro: Miquelia umbellata, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lecanodendraceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in umbellate clusters, giving it its scientific name. Miquelia umbellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
